agents

Class HostCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • jade.core.Agent
      • agents.BasicAgent
        • agents.HostCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jade.core.TimerListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, P2PVocabulary

    public class HostCache
extends BasicAgent
    The Host Cache is responsible for adding new peers to a list of connected peers and supplying peers with a list of Super Peers in the network.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addPeer

        public void addPeer(jade.core.AID peer,
           boolean isSuper)
        Adds the peer to the network (but only if it isn't already present)
        Parameters:
        peer - AID of the joining Peer.
        isSuper - Whether the Peer is a Super Peer or not.

      • getNeighboursFor

        public java.lang.String getNeighboursFor(jade.core.AID peer)
        A list of Super Peer local names for another peer. Excludes the peer itself. The Host Cache returns a random selection of peers, to introduce evenness in the network.
        Parameters:
        peer - Requester (we want to exclude them from the list.)
        Returns:
        semicolon-delimited list of local peer names.
